meanings.definition: A person or thing that is new or recently acquired.
meanings.sent1: The shiny red bike was a newie in the garage.
meanings.sent2: The family's puppy was a newie and still learning the house rules.
meanings.sent3: The newie in the office accidentally hit 'reply all' to an email.
meanings.sent4: The fresh snow on the mountain was a newie blanket covering the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The newie student was eager to make friends and explore the school.

meanings.sent1: The young newie in the soccer team was excited to play his first match.
meanings.sent2: The newie in the book club was eager to join the discussions.
meanings.sent3: The newie to the hiking group got lost on the easiest trail.
meanings.sent4: The newie in the kitchen felt like a fish out of water.
meanings.sent5: The newie singer impressed everyone with her raw talent.

meanings.sent1: The newie at the company was still learning the ropes.
meanings.sent2: The newie recruit showed great potential during training.
meanings.sent3: The newie employee accidentally spilled coffee on the boss.
meanings.sent4: The newie on the team brought fresh ideas to the project.
meanings.sent5: The newie hire quickly adapted to the company culture.
